intro: Salpiglossis variabilis, commonly known as the variable calico flower, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, colorful, tubular flowers that range from red to orange and yellow. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with hairy stems and alternate leaves. Its flowers are pollinated primarily by hummingbirds, which are attracted to its nectar-rich structure. The plant is cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained soil with full sun exposure.
